author: Special Correspondent
text:
Taking cognisance of a CBI charge-sheet, a Delhi court on Monday summoned former Minister of State for Coal Dilip Ray as an accused in a coal block allocation scam case. Mr. Ray was the State Minister in the Coal Ministry in the Atal Bihari Vajpayee Cabinet in 1999.

Special Judge Bharat Parashar also summoned Pradip Kumar Banerjee, then Additional Secretary and Nitya Nand Gautam, then advisor (projects) in the Ministry and Castron Technologies Ltd. director Mahendra Kumar Agarwalla as accused in the case. The court asked them to appear before it on February 26. The case pertains to the allocation of Brahmadiha coal block in Giridih in Jharkhand to Castron Technologies Ltd in 1999 in an illegal manner. The court summoned them under Sections 120-B (criminal conspiracy), 420 (cheating) and 409 (criminal breach of trust) of IPC and also under the provisions of the Prevention of Corruption Act. Stating that there is prima facie enough evidence to summon them as accused in the case, the court said: “The public servants, in fact, actively connived with private parties involved so as to facilitate misappropriation of nationalised natural resources of the country by them.”
title: Ex-Minister summoned in a coal block case
